metadata.Title: CVE-2020-22025 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A heap-based Buffer Overflow vulnerability exists in gaussian_blur at libavfilter/vf_edgedetect.c, which might lead to memory corruption and other potential consequences.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-22025` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1
libavcodec-extra - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1
libavcodec-extra57 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1
libavcodec57 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1
libavdevice57 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1
libavfilter-extra - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1
libavfilter-extra6 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1
libavfilter6 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1
libavformat57 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1
libavresample3 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1
libavutil55 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1
libpostproc54 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1
libswresample2 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1
libswscale4 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1').
qtwebengine-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
vice: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
